Notes: กำลัง before a verb marks an action happening right now (present continuous)
Basic verb “to eat”; here with กำลัง as present continuous

Thai Script Phrase: ยังกินอยู่
Notes: ยัง before the verb = “still”; shows action not finished

Thai Script Phrase: ยังกินอยู่
Notes: Same verb “eat”; อยู่ at the end keeps it ongoing

Thai Script Phrase: ยังกินอยู่
Notes: อยู่ at the end marks a continuing action
แล้ว after the verb marks completion / “already”
จะ before a verb = “will / going to” (future or intention)
Verb “eat”; action planned for the future
“Go (and) run”; can add place or time after
Verb “run / jog”; often used for exercise
Base verb “run”; past/completed because of แล้ว
แล้ว shows the action is done/completed
Verb “sit”; can also mean “sat down already”
